title: How to Get a G'joob by Breeding in My Singing Monsters

steps.title: Obtain some parent monsters.
steps.content: Obtain some parent monsters. G'joob can be bred with two combinations: a Pummel and a T-Rox on Plant Island, or a Cataliszt and a G'joob on Mythical Island. If you don't already have a G'joob and are having trouble finding one elsewhere, find and obtain a Pummel and a T-Rox. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Level the parents to level 4.
steps.content: Level the parents to level 4. Monsters must be at least level 4 to breed, so level up your Pummel and T-Rox if they're not already at least level 4. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish.
steps.content: Upgrade your Breeding Structures, if you wish. While not necessary, you can upgrade your Breeding Structures to reduce breeding times by 25%. You can upgrade your structure by spending 25 diamonds. You can also add Wishing Torches around your Breeding Structure to help increase the odds of a rare monster being bred. [3] X Research source Wishing Torches can be lit for 24 hours by paying 2 diamonds or be lit permanently by paying 100 diamonds.

steps.title: Breed the parent monsters.
steps.content: Breed the parent monsters. Once you're ready to breed your monsters, put them in the Breeding Structure. A G'joob egg is white with blue speckles and a large blue spot, with tan-colored horns and pipe tusks similar to a G'joob. [4] X Research source Make sure to breed outside of a Rare monster availability window. If there is an event going on that allows Rare monsters to be bred, you could end up breeding a Rare Noggin, Rare T-Rox, or Rare Toe Jammer with a combination of a Pummel and T-Rox. This will decrease your chances that the Pummel and T-Rox will breed a G'joob. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for your G'joob to hatch.
steps.content: Wait for your G'joob to hatch. It will take 18 hours to hatch, or 13 hours and 30 minutes if you've upgraded your breeding structure.
